title: People's Choice Awards 2017: Jennifer Lopez, Blake Lively, Joel McHale and Tom Hanks lead red carpet arrivals
text:

A sea of famous faces have descended on the 2017 People's Choice Awards as they kick off at the Microsoft Theater in Los Angeles tonight. 
Jennifer Lopez and Blake Lively led the red carpet arrivals, with J-Lo opting for a chic and sophisticated black fishtail gown with delicate jewelled detailing around the cleavage. 
In contrast, Blake Lively dared to bare in a thigh-skimming glitzy dress that highlighted her slim legs. 
The actress looked a million dollars in the glamorous black design as she posed for pictures on the red carpet. Jennifer Lopez (Photo: Rex Features) Jennifer Lopez (Photo: Rex Features) 
Joel McHale, who looked dapper in a tux as he was joined by his wife Sarah Williams, has been chosen as this year’s awards host and as well as hosting duties, he’ll also be cheering on his TV show The Great Outdoors, which has been nominated in the Favourite New TV Comedy category. Blake Lively (Photo: Rex Features) 
And all eyes will be on Fifth Harmony who will be making their live debut as a four-piece, following the shock departure of Camila Cabello last month. They’re also up for the Favourite Group award. 
Another confirmed performer is Gwen Stefani’s boyfriend Blake Shelton, who is a country superstar and coach on the US version of The Voice. Actor Tom Hanks (Photo: WireImage) Joel McHale and wife Sarah Williams (Photo: Rex Features) 
He’s up for three awards this year: Favourite Male Artist, Favourite Male Country Artist and Favourite Album. 
While the winners are still to be determined, the People's Choice Favourite Humanitarian gong will go to Tyler Perry, whose Tyler Perry Foundation has helped numerous charities over the years. 
“Mr. Perry’s decades long commitment to helping those in need is incomparable," said People's Choice President Fred Nelson. In honour of Perry, $100,000 has been donated to his choice charity, Global Medical Relief Fund for Children.
